question.title: Convert Date Format
question.content:
Table: Days

+-------------+------+
| Column Name | Type |
+-------------+------+
| day         | date |
+-------------+------+
day is the primary key for this table.

 

Write an SQL query to convert each date in Days into a string formatted as "day_name, month_name day, year".

Return the result table in any order.

The query result format is in the following example.

 

Example 1:

Input: 
Days table:
+------------+
| day        |
+------------+
| 2022-04-12 |
| 2021-08-09 |
| 2020-06-26 |
+------------+
Output: 
+-------------------------+
| day                     |
+-------------------------+
| Tuesday, April 12, 2022 |
| Monday, August 9, 2021  |
| Friday, June 26, 2020   |
+-------------------------+
Explanation: Please note that the output is case-sensitive.

codeSnippets.code: # Write your MySQL query statement below
/* Write your T-SQL query statement below */
/* Write your PL/SQL query statement below */

mysqlSchemas: Create table If Not Exists Days (day date)
